intro: Dalea hutchinsoniae, commonly known as the Hutchinson's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several pairs of small, oval-shaped leaflets. Dalea hutchinsoniae plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects and small animals.
